messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Where can I sell books on-line?
messages.msgSnippet: I would be interested in knowing what you have. I just started unschooling/homeschooling 4 weeks ago. Right now, we are taking it easy a bit with a lot of
messages.messageBody:
I would be interested in knowing what you have. I just started
unschooling/homeschooling 4 weeks ago. Right now, we are taking it easy a
bit with a lot of reading from books and doing at least 2 math papers a
week that I download and print out from a free worksheet website. Naomi
does have a penpal and she also writes to her cousin once a week. I'm
trying to see if she would write in her journal more often...think if she
sees me doing it, she will do the same <G>. I am a rubber stamper and
crafter...so we do make a lot of cards and other things with rubber
stamps (been doing this for 6 years). I also make homemade bread and
thats one of our projects tomorrow. Naomi helps me with grocery shopping,
cleaning, laundry as well as school. I'm a single parent and disabled and
because of that disability..I am able to stay home with her.
Jessica

messages.subject: Homeschooling Resources List (was Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Where can I sell books on-line?)
messages.msgSnippet: ... The new Homeschooling Resources list focuses on materials and resources of interest to homeschooling families. Discuss your favorite books, videos,
messages.messageBody:
At 6:33 AM -0600 3/6/01, Russ Anderson wrote:
>I have lots of curriculum type stuff that I would like to un-load (before
>our move)..Any suggestions for the best on-line spot to list things? I have
>already sold most of my old Sonlight stuff on their buy/sell board with
>great success.. but not sure what to do with the rest?

The new Homeschooling Resources list focuses on materials and
resources of interest to homeschooling families. Discuss your
favorite books, videos, catalogs, websites, software, games,
publications, conferences and much more!

The list also welcomes press releases, product announcements, news
and information about resources of interest to homeschooling families
- and used curriculum offers.

To join the list send a blank email message to:
HomeschoolingResources-subscribe@yahoogroups.com

For information or to join the list please go to the website:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/HomeschoolingResources

Another great list sponsored by the award-winning Home Education Magazine!

Helen Hegener, Managing Editor
Home Education Magazine
HEM-Editor@...
http://www.home-ed-magazine.com

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Where can I sell books on-line?
messages.msgSnippet: www.vegsource.com/homeschool is a great place to sell used curriculum. Their for sale/want ads are in the right hand column on the site.   I ve sold quite a
messages.messageBody:
www.vegsource.com/homeschool is a great place to sell used curriculum.  Their for sale/want ads are in the right hand column on the site.   I've sold quite a few things there and bought several items too.
 
Blessings, Lenise
 
I have lots of curriculum type stuff that I would like to un-load (before
our move)..Any suggestions for the best on-line spot to list things?  I have
already sold most of my old Sonlight stuff on their buy/sell board with
great success.. but not sure what to do with the rest?
Thanks,
Julie in MO

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Where can I sell books on-line?
messages.msgSnippet: I don t know if it s best for curriculum stuff, but I ve sold lots of books at half.com.  They sold fast. April ... From: Russ Anderson
messages.messageBody:
I don't know if it's best for curriculum stuff, but I've sold lots of books
at half.com. They sold fast.

April
